summary: A CBP supervisor documents that CBPAS Timothy ROUTCH voluntarily reported that a female acquaintance has filed two complaints against him: one to the DOJ alleging he assisted Jeffrey Epstein in human trafficking of underage females while working in St. Thomas, and one to local sheriff's department alleging predatory behavior. The supervisor notes ROUTCH's admission of friendship with Epstein and recalls prior concerning personal conduct.

persons.name: Timothy ROUTCH
persons.role: CBPAS (Customs and Border Protection Agriculture Specialist)
persons.context: CBP employee who voluntarily informed his supervisor that a female acquaintance filed complaints against him, including an allegation that he assisted Jeffrey Epstein in human trafficking while working in St. Thomas. He admitted being friends with Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in a DOJ complaint filed by ROUTCH's acquaintance, alleging ROUTCH assisted him in human trafficking of underage females. ROUTCH admitted to being friends with him, visiting his house, boat, and flying in his helicopter.

connections.description: ROUTCH admitted to being friends with Epstein, having been to his house, on his boat, and flown in his helicopter for whale watching. An acquaintance alleged ROUTCH assisted Epstein in human trafficking.
A lady ROUTCH recently dated who filed two complaints against him (to DOJ and local sheriff). She had previously attempted suicide, and ROUTCH took time off to visit her in the hospital.
An older female landlord in Charleston with whom ROUTCH had a dispute that went to court over monetary exchange for home repair services to lower rent.

events.title: ROUTCH reports complaints to supervisor
events.description: CBPAS Timothy ROUTCH voluntarily informs his supervisor that a female acquaintance has filed two law enforcement complaints against him, including one alleging association with Jeffrey Epstein and assistance in human trafficking.

events.title: ROUTCH begins work in St. Thomas
events.description: Timothy ROUTCH begins working at the CBP pre-clearance port in Saint Thomas, USVI, where he later befriended Jeffrey Epstein through his official duties.

events.title: DOJ complaint filed alleging Epstein connection
events.description: A female acquaintance files a complaint with the U.S. Department of Justice alleging ROUTCH is a known associate of Jeffrey Epstein and assisted him in human trafficking of underage females while working in St. Thomas.

events.title: Local sheriff complaint filed alleging predatory behavior
events.description: The same female acquaintance files a complaint with the Charleston County Sheriff Department accusing ROUTCH of predatory behavior targeting widows and vulnerable persons.

locations: 1601 - CBP CES, Supervisor's office, North Charleston, SC
keyFacts: A CBP employee, Timothy ROUTCH, was accused by an acquaintance of assisting Jeffrey Epstein in human trafficking of underage females while ROUTCH worked at the CBP pre-clearance port in Saint Thomas.
ROUTCH admitted to his supervisor that he was friends with Jeffrey Epstein, had been to his house, on his boat, and flew in his helicopter for whale watching.
The same acquaintance also filed a local complaint accusing ROUTCH of predatory behavior targeting widows and vulnerable persons.
The supervisor's report notes prior concerning behavior by ROUTCH, including a court dispute with a female landlord over monetary exchanges for home repairs.
The document highlights potential reputational risk to CBP from an employee's alleged association with a convicted child molester and human trafficking.
